newsitem.title: USA: Intl Family, News won't comment.
newsitem.headline: Intl Family, News won't comment.

text.p: Both International Family Entertainment Inc and News Corp Ltd declined comment Wednesday on a report that a deal was near for News Corp to buy International Family, the owner of the Family Channel cable television network.
The Wall Street Journal reported that News Corp was getting closer to cutting a $1 billion deal to buy International Family.
The newspaper, quoting sources close to the talks, reported that a stumbling block surfaced after the Robertson family sought a premium for its Class A shares.
International Family Class B shares rose 1-5/8 to 23-1/8. News Corp ADRs dropped 1/2 to 17-3/4.
Five million Class A shares are closely held by the Robertson family and various trusts. The shares control 60 percent of the voting power of the total outstanding shares.
About 32.7 million Class B shares are publicly traded. Seven million non-voting class C shares are held by Tele-Communications Inc's Liberty Media Corp.
